member.name: P:MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.BatchSettings.Enabled
member.summary: If true, messages are queued up to send in batches to reduce broker round-trip calls

member.summary: The maximum number of messages to include in a batch

member.name: P:MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.BatchSettings.SizeLimit
member.summary: A rough size limit for a batch of messages

member.name: P:MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.BatchSettings.Timeout
member.summary: The time to wait for more messages before sending a batch. Should be small, like < 10 milliseconds

member.summary: Specify the queue should be durable (survives broker restart) or in-memory

member.name: P:MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.IExchangeConfigurator.AutoDelete
member.summary: Specify that the queue (and the exchange of the same name) should be created as auto-delete

member.name: P:MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.IQueueConfigurator.Exclusive
member.summary: Specify that the queue is exclusive to this process and cannot be accessed by other processes at the same time.

member.name: P:MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.IQueueConfigurator.Lazy
member.summary: Sets the queue to be lazy (using less memory)

member.summary: Set the queue to expire after the specified time

member.summary: Set a queue argument passed to the broker on queue declaration

member.summary: Specify the maximum number of concurrent messages that are consumed

member.name: P:MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.IQueueEndpointConfigurator.PurgeOnStartup
member.summary: Purge the messages from an existing queue on startup (note that upon reconnection to the server the queue will not be purged again, only when the service is restarted).

member.name: P:MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.IQueueEndpointConfigurator.ExclusiveConsumer
member.summary: Should the consumer have exclusive access to the queue

member.summary: Configure the send topology of the message type

member.name: M:MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.IRabbitMqBusFactoryConfigurator.OverrideDefaultBusEndpointQueueName(System.String)
member.summary: In most cases, this is not needed and should not be used. However, if for any reason the default bus endpoint queue name needs to be changed, this will do it. Do NOT set it to the same name as a receive endpoint or you will screw things up.

member.name: M:MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.IRabbitMqBusFactoryConfigurator.Host(MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.RabbitMqHostSettings)
member.summary: Configure a Host that can be connected. If only one host is specified, it is used as the default host for receive endpoints.

member.name: M:MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.IRabbitMqClusterConfigurator.Node(System.String)
member.summary: Add a node to the cluster, which may include a host name, and an option port number.

member.name: P:MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.IRabbitMqHostConfigurator.PublisherConfirmation
member.summary: Enables RabbitMQ publish acknowledgement, so that the Task returned from Send/Publish is not completed until the message has been confirmed by the broker.

member.name: M:MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.IRabbitMqHostConfigurator.UseSsl(System.Action{MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.IRabbitMqSslConfigurator})
member.summary: Configure the use of SSL to connection to RabbitMQ

member.name: M:MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.IRabbitMqHostConfigurator.Heartbeat(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Specifies the heartbeat interval, in seconds, used to maintain the connection to RabbitMQ. Setting this value to zero will disable heartbeats, allowing the connection to timeout after an inactivity period.

member.name: M:MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.IRabbitMqHostConfigurator.Heartbeat(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Specifies the heartbeat interval, used to maintain the connection to RabbitMQ. Setting this value to TimeSpan.Zero will disable heartbeats, allowing the connection to timeout after an inactivity period.

member.name: T:MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.IRabbitMqSslConfigurator
member.summary: Configures SSL/TLS for RabbitMQ. See http://www.rabbitmq.com/ssl.html for details on how to set up RabbitMQ for SSL.

member.summary: The SSL protocol version.

member.summary: The server canonical name. The name has to match CN in the server certificate.

member.name: P:MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.IRabbitMqSslConfigurator.CertificatePath
member.summary: The path to a file containing a certificate to use for client authentication, not required if is populated

member.name: P:MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.IRabbitMqSslConfigurator.CertificatePassphrase
member.summary: The password for the certificate file at

member.name: P:MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.IRabbitMqSslConfigurator.Certificate
member.summary: A certficate instance to use for client authentication, if provided then and are not required

member.name: P:MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.IRabbitMqSslConfigurator.UseCertificateAsAuthenticationIdentity
member.summary: Whether to use client certificate to authenticate the client. If false, client certificate is used only for SSL encryption.

member.name: P:MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.IRabbitMqSslConfigurator.CertificateSelectionCallback
member.summary: An optional client specified SSL certificate selection callback. If this is not specified, the first valid certificate found will be used.

member.name: P:MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.IRabbitMqSslConfigurator.CertificateValidationCallback
member.summary: An optional client specified SSL certificate validation callback. If this is not specified, the default callback will be used in conjunction with the property to determine if the remote server certificate is valid.

member.name: M:MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.Integration.IPublisher.Publish(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,RabbitMQ.Client.IBasicProperties,System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Publish the message to RabbitMQ. The returned Task is completed depending upon the configuration of the channel/connection. If publisher confirmation is disable, and batch is disabled, the Task is completed immediately. If publisher confirmation is enabled, the Task is completed once the broker has confirmed the message. If publisher confirmation is disabled, but batch is enabled, the task is completed once the batch has been sent to the broker.
member.param: Complete the Task only once the message has been confirmed, if confirmation is enabled

member.summary: A pending BasicPublish to RabbitMQ, waiting for an ACK/NAK from the broker

member.summary: Use the message scheduler to schedule redelivery of a specific message type based upon the retry policy, via the delayed exchange feature of RabbitMQ.

member.name: M:MassTransit.DelayedRedeliveryExtensions.UseDelayedRedelivery(MassTransit.RabbitMqTransport.IRabbitMqReceiveEndpointConfigurator,System.Action{GreenPipes.Configurators.IRetryConfigurator})
member.summary: For all configured messages type (handlers, consumers, and sagas), configures delayed redelivery using the retry configuration specified. Redelivery is configured once for each message type, and is added prior to the consumer factory or saga repository in the pipeline.
